intro: Scolymocephalus obtusifolius, commonly known as the blunt-leaf scolymus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy stems and broad, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Scolymocephalus obtusifolius is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
